intro: Sisymbrium hispanicum, commonly known as the Spanish peppergrass, is an annual herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features slender, branched stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its seeds are encased in a distinctive, pitted capsule that splits open when mature to release the seeds. Sisymbrium hispanicum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and fields.
